intro: Triumfetta abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to Africa, particularly Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Triumfetta abyssinica is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions.
